metadata.title: CVE-2023-4622 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's af_unix component canbe exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Theunix_stream_sendpage() function tries to add data to the last skb in thepeer's recv queue without locking the queue. Thus there is a race whereunix_stream_sendpage() could access an skb locklessly that is beingreleased by garbage collection, resulting in use-after-free. We recommendupgrading past commit 790c2f9d15b594350ae9bca7b236f2b1859de02c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4622` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-lowlatency - 4.15.0-219.230
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-165-generic - 5.4.0-165.182~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-165-lowlatency - 5.4.0-165.182~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1146-kvm - 4.15.0-1146.151
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-219.230').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
